snippet: An explosion that killed four Marines last year was most likely caused by a dropped or kicked grenade, and two Marines were relieved of duty as a result, officials said.
abstract: Military officials say explosion during training exercise that killed four Marines at Camp Pendleton in 2013 was most likely caused by a dropped or kicked grenade, and two Marines are relieved of duty as a result.
lead_paragraph: An explosion that killed four Marines last year was most likely caused by a dropped or kicked grenade, and two Marines were relieved of duty as a result, officials said.

headline.main: 2 Marines Disciplined After 4 Die at Pendleton
headline.print_headline: 2 Marines Disciplined After 4 Die at Pendleton

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
